title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
Fork CMS 5.0.7 has XSS in /private/en/pages/edit via the title parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-5215
  • https://github.com/imsebao/404team/blob/master/forkcms.md
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8fjq-cpr7-cmfp
items.title: [forkcms/forkcms] Fork CMS XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
An issue was discovered in Joomla! Core starting in 3.0.0 and prior to 3.8.8. Inadequate input filtering leads to a multiple XSS vulnerabilities. Additionally, the default filtering settings could potentially allow users of the default Administrator user group to perform a XSS attack.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-11326
  • https://developer.joomla.org/security-centre/733-20180505-core-xss-vulnerabilities-additional-hadering.html
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210124173032/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/104270
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211129145422/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1040966
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g3m5-vvj7-xrwv
items.title: [joomla/joomla-cms] Joomla! XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
The Yii2-StateMachine extension v2.x.x for Yii2 has XSS.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-12290
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20180624194633/http://www.iwantacve.cn/index.php/archives/40/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-65qg-f77j-cccf
items.title: [ptheofan/yii2-statemachine] Yii2-StateMachine extension for Yii2 XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
baserCMS (baserCMS 4.1.0.1 and earlier versions, baserCMS 3.0.15 and earlier versions) allows remote authenticated attackers to execute arbitrary OS commands via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-0569
  • https://basercms.net/security/JVN67881316
  • http://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN67881316/index.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6j3p-vrph-j7qq
items.title: [baserproject/basercms] OS Command Injection in baserCMS

items.content_html:

items.content_html:
baserCMS (baserCMS 4.1.0.1 and earlier versions, baserCMS 3.0.15 and earlier versions) allows remote attackers to bypass access restriction in mail form to view a file which is uploaded by a site user via unspecified vectors.

items.content_html:
Subrion CMS v4.2.1 is vulnerable to Stored XSS because of no escaping added to the tooltip information being displayed in multiple areas.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-14835
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/issues/760
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/pull/763
  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/commit/a33a224c6c9e25144d828f92f6141c719215094b
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c8mg-wp7h-f2pf
items.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS XSS

items.content_html:
phpMyFAQ before 2.9.11 allows CSRF.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-16650
  • https://www.phpmyfaq.de/security/advisory-2018-09-02
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-p57w-9q28-j6v7
items.title: [thorsten/phpmyfaq] phpMyFAQ CSRF

items.content_html:
Microweber version <= 1.0.7 contains a Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Admin login form template that can result in Execution of JavaScript code.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-1000826
  • https://github.com/microweber/microweber/issues/489
  • https://0dd.zone/2018/10/28/microweber-XSS/
  • https://github.com/microweber/microweber/commit/5b29bc854bcfbfc5d4df1523ee221c900e7598a9
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xmcr-x5x3-gjfx
items.title: [microweber/microweber] Microweber XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Fork CMS 5.0.6 allows stored XSS via the private/en/settings facebook_admin_ids parameter (aka "Admin ids" input in the Facebook section).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-20682
  • https://www.netsparker.com/web-applications-advisories/ns-18-032-stored-cross-site-scripting-in-forkcms/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xcmj-xjhg-wvhq
items.title: [forkcms/forkcms] Fork CMS XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
In the orders section of PrestaShop before 1.7.2.5, an attack is possible after gaining access to a target store with a user role with the rights of at least a Salesman or higher privileges. The attacker can then inject arbitrary PHP objects into the process and abuse an object chain in order to gain Remote Code Execution. This occurs because protection against serialized objects looks for a 0: followed by an integer, but does not consider 0:+ followed by an integer.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-20717
  • https://blog.ripstech.com/2018/prestashop-remote-code-execution/
  • https://build.prestashop.com/news/prestashop-1-7-2-5-maintenance-release/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xx67-2j3v-h76p
items.title: [prestashop/prestashop] PrestaShop PHP Object Injection

items.content_html:
Kirby v2.5.12 allows XSS by using the "site files" Add option to upload an SVG file.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-16630
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20201208015414/https://github.com/security-breachlock/CVE-2018-16630/blob/master/Kirby_Insecure%20file%20validation.pdf
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3gq5-r59m-mmv2
items.title: [getkirby/kirby] Kirby XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
panel/uploads/#elf_l1_XA in Subrion CMS v4.2.1 allows XSS via an SVG file with JavaScript in a SCRIPT element.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-16629

  • https://github.com/intelliants/subrion/commit/fbc29ddb29e9c9732695e25ad2c22e038eed6385
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mxv3-qcmf-r6wj
items.title: [intelliants/subrion] Subrion CMS XSS

items.content_html:
Microweber 1.0.8 has reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-19917
  • https://www.netsparker.com/web-applications-advisories/ns-18-038-reflected-cross-site-scripting-in-microweber/
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/151005/Microweber-1.0.8-Cross-Site-Scripting.html
  • http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2019/Jan/12
  • http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2019/Jan/25
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-582j-m369-hj2f
items.title: [microweber/microweber] Microweber XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
In Laravel Framework through 5.5.40 and 5.6.x through 5.6.29, remote code execution might occur as a result of an unserialize call on a potentially untrusted X-XSRF-TOKEN value. This involves the decrypt method in Illuminate/Encryption/Encrypter.php and PendingBroadcast in gadgetchains/Laravel/RCE/3/chain.php in phpggc. The attacker must know the application key, which normally would never occur, but could happen if the attacker previously had privileged access or successfully accomplished a previous attack.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-15133
  • https://laravel.com/docs/5.6/upgrade#upgrade-5.6.30
  • http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/153641/PHP-Laravel-Framework-Token-Unserialize-Remote-Command-Execution.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qvqm-h22r-4cp9
items.title: [laravel/framework] Laravel Framework RCE Vulnerability
